titles.en: Chapter 27 – The Praise and the Glorification

titles.ar: بَابُ ذِكْرِ اللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ فِي الْغَافِلِينَ
titles.en: Chapter 26 – Zikr (Mention) of Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Mighty and Majestic among the oblivious ones
Chapter 27 – The Praise and the Glorification

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مختلف فيه - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (12/144)

narrator_chain.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ أَبِي سَعِيدٍ الْقَمَّاطِ عَنِ الْمُفَضَّلِ قَالَ

text: قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) جُعِلْتُ فِدَاكَ عَلِّمْنِي دُعَاءً جَامِعاً فَقَالَ لِيَ احْمَدِ اللَّهَ فَإِنَّهُ لَا يَبْقَى أَحَدٌ يُصَلِّي إِلَّا دَعَا لَكَ يَقُولُ سَمِعَ اللَّهُ لِمَنْ حَمِدَهُ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Abu Saeed Al Qammat, from Al Mufazzal who said,

‘I said to Abu Abdullahasws, ‘May I be sacrificed for youasws! Teach me a comprehensive supplication’. So heasws said to me: ‘Praise Allahazwj, for there would not remain anyone who prays Salat except he would be supplicating for you saying, ‘Allahazwj Hears the one who Praises Himazwj’ (the phrase spoken after Ruku’u)’.
en.sarwar: 1. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from abu Sa’Id al-Qammat from al-Mufaddal who has said the following: “Once I said to abu ‘Abd Allah (a.s.) ‘May Allah keep my soul in service for your cause, teach me a comperehensive prayer.’ The Imam said to me, ‘Praise Allah; everyone who performs prayer prays for you saying, “Allah listens to (answers the prayers of) those who praise Him” (a reference to the meaning of the phrase said after Ruku ’ in a prayer).’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (12/145)

narrator_chain.text: عَنْهُ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ الْحُسَيْنِ عَنْ سَيْفِ بْنِ عَمِيرَةَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مَرْوَانَ قَالَ

text: قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) أَيُّ الْأَعْمَالِ أَحَبُّ إِلَى اللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ فَقَالَ أَنْ تَحْمَدَهُ .

en.hubeali: From him, from Ali Bin Al Husayn, from Sayf Bin Ameyra, from Muhammad Bin Marwan who said,
‘I said to Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>, ‘Which of the deeds is the most Beloved to Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Mighty and Majestic?’ So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Your praising Him<sup>azwj</sup>’.
en.sarwar: 2. It is narrated from him (narrator of the Hadith above) from Ali ibn al-Husayn from Sayf ibn ‘Amirah from Muhammad ibn Marwan who has said the following: “Once I asked abu ‘Abd Allah (a.s.) ‘What deed is the most beloved to Allah, the Most Majestic, the Most Holy?’ The Imam said, ‘It is your deed of praising Him.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (12/145)

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ أَبِي الْحَسَنِ الْأَنْبَارِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: كَانَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) يَحْمَدُ اللَّهَ فِي كُلِّ يَوْمٍ ثَلَاثَمِائَةِ مَرَّةٍ وَ سِتِّينَ مَرَّةً عَدَدَ عُرُوقِ الْجَسَدِ يَقُولُ الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ كَثِيراً عَلَى كُلِّ حَالٍ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bn Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Abu Al Hassan Al Anbary,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup> used to praise Allah<sup>azwj</sup> during every day, three hundred and sixty times (360), of the number of the veins in the body, saying: ‘الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ’ ‘The Praise is for Allah<sup>azwj</sup>, Lord<sup>azwj</sup> of the worlds, a lot, upon every state’.
en.sarwar: 3. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ibn abu ‘Umayr from abu al- Hassan al-Anbari from abu ‘Abd Allah (a.s.) who has said the following: “The Messenger of Allah would praise Allah everyday, three hundred sixty times, equal to the number of the veins in the body, saying ‘All praise belongs to Allah, Lord of the worlds, a great deal of praise in all conditions.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: حسن موثق - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (12/145)

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ وَ حُمَيْدُ بْنُ زِيَادٍ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ جَمِيعاً عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ الْحَسَنِ الْمِيثَمِيِّ عَنْ يَعْقُوبَ بْنِ شُعَيْبٍ قَالَ

text: سَمِعْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) يَقُولُ قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) إِنَّ فِي ابْنِ آدَمَ ثَلَاثَمِائَةٍ وَ سِتِّينَ عِرْقاً مِنْهَا مِائَةٌ وَ ثَمَانُونَ مُتَحَرِّكَةٌ وَ مِنْهَا مِائَةٌ وَ ثَمَانُونَ سَاكِنَةٌ فَلَوْ سَكَنَ الْمُتَحَرِّكُ لَمْ يَنَمْ وَ لَوْ تَحَرَّكَ السَّاكِنُ لَمْ يَنَمْ وَ كَانَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) إِذَا أَصْبَحَ قَالَ الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ كَثِيراً عَلَى كُلِّ حَالٍ ثَلَاثَمِائَةٍ وَ سِتِّينَ مَرَّةً وَ إِذَا أَمْسَى قَالَ مِثْلَ ذَلِكَ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, and Humeyd Bin Ziyad, from Al Hassan Bin Muhammad, altogether from Ahmad Bin Al Hassan Al Maysami, from Yaqoub Bin Shuayb who said,

‘‘I heard Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> saying: ‘Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup> said: ‘In the son of Adam<sup>as</sup> there are three hundred and sixty veins – from these one hundred and eighty are moving and from these one hundred and eighty are still. If the moving ones were to stay still he would not (be able to) sleep, and if the still ones were to move, he would not (be able to) sleep; and it was so that Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup>, whenever it was morning, said:

‘الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ’ ‘The Praise is for Allah<sup>azwj</sup>, Lord<sup>azwj</sup> of the worlds, a lot, upon every state’, three hundred and sixty times, and whenever it was evening, said similar to that’.
en.sarwar: 4. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father and Humayd ibn Ziyad from al- Hassan ibn Muhammad all from Ahmad ibn al-Hassan al-Mithami from Ya’qub ibn Shu’ayb who has said the following: “I heard abu ‘Abd Allah (a.s.) saying, ‘The Messenger of Allah has said that in a son of Adam there are three hundred sixty veins of which one hundred eighty are moving and one hundred eighty are quiet. If a moving vein becomes quiet one cannot sleep and if a quiet one moves one cannot sleep’. The Messenger of Allah in the morning would say, ‘All praise belongs to Allah, Lord of the worlds, a great deal of praise in all conditions, three hundred sixty times and so also he would do in the evening.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (2/147)

narrator_chain.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ خَالِدٍ عَنْ مَنْصُورِ بْنِ الْعَبَّاسِ عَنْ سَعِيدِ بْنِ جَنَاحٍ قَالَ حَدَّثَنِي أَبُو مَسْعُودٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: مَنْ قَالَ أَرْبَعَ مَرَّاتٍ إِذَا أَصْبَحَ الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ فَقَدْ أَدَّى شُكْرَ يَوْمِهِ وَ مَنْ قَالَهَا إِذَا أَمْسَى فَقَدْ أَدَّى شُكْرَ لَيْلَتِهِ .

en.hubeali: A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad Bin Khalid, from Mansour Bin Al Abbas, from Saeed Bin Janah who said, ‘Abu Masoud narrated to me,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘The one who says four times when it is the morning, الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ’ ‘The Praise is for Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Lord<sup>azwj</sup> of the worlds’, so he has paid the thanks for his day, and the one who says it when it is the evening, so he has paid his thanks for his night’.
en.sarwar: 5. A number of our people have narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn Khalid from Mansur ibn al-‘Abbas from Sa’Id ibn Janah who has said that narrated to him abu Mas’Ud from abu ‘Abd Allah (a.s.) who has said the following: “Whoever says four times in the morning, ‘All praise belongs to Allah, Lord of the worlds,’ has completed his thanksgiving for that day and if one does the same thing in the evening he has completed his thanksgiving for the night.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (2/148)

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ حَسَّانَ عَنْ بَعْضِ أَصْحَابِهِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: كُلُّ دُعَاءٍ لَا يَكُونُ قَبْلَهُ تَحْمِيدٌ فَهُوَ أَبْتَرُ إِنَّمَا التَّحْمِيدُ ثُمَّ الثَّنَاءُ قُلْتُ مَا أَدْرِي مَا يُجْزِي مِنَ التَّحْمِيدِ وَ التَّمْجِيدِ قَالَ يَقُولُ

اللَّهُمَّ أَنْتَ الْأَوَّلُ فَلَيْسَ قَبْلَكَ شَيْ‏ءٌ وَ أَنْتَ الْآخِرُ فَلَيْسَ بَعْدَكَ شَيْ‏ءٌ وَ أَنْتَ الظَّاهِرُ فَلَيْسَ فَوْقَكَ شَيْ‏ءٌ وَ أَنْتَ الْبَاطِنُ فَلَيْسَ دُونَكَ شَيْ‏ءٌ وَ أَنْتَ الْعَزِيزُ الْحَكِيمُ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ali Bin Hassan, from one of his companions,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Every supplication which does not happen to have a Praise before it, so it is cut-off. But rather, it is the Praise, then the Laudation’. I said, ‘What I don’t know is, what would suffice me from the Praise and the Glorification’. He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘One should be saying,

‘O Allah<sup>azwj</sup>! You<sup>azwj</sup> are the Foremost, so there was nothing before You<sup>azwj</sup>, and You<sup>azwj</sup> are the Last, so there will be nothing after You<sup>azwj</sup>, and You<sup>azwj</sup> are the Manifest, so there is nothing above You<sup>azwj</sup>, and You<sup>azwj</sup> are the Hidden, so there is nothing besides You<sup>azwj</sup>, and You<sup>azwj</sup> are the Mighty, the Wise’’.
en.sarwar: 6. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from Ali ibn Hassan from certain individuals of his people from abu ‘Abd Allah (a.s.) who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah (a.s.) has said, ‘Any prayer that does not have thanksgiving before it is incomplete. First it is thanksgiving, then praising.’ I (the narrator) then asked, ‘I do not know what is enough for thanksgiving?’ The Imam said one should say, ‘O Lord, You are the First, no one was ever before You, You are the Last and there will be no one after You, You are the Dominant and there is no one above You, You are the Inside and there is no one before You and You are the Majestic, the Wise.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (2/151)
text: سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) مَا أَدْنَى مَا يُجْزِي مِنَ التَّحْمِيدِ قَالَ تَقُولُ

الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ الَّذِي عَلَا فَقَهَرَ وَ الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ الَّذِي مَلَكَ فَقَدَرَ وَ الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ الَّذِي بَطَنَ فَخَبَرَ وَ الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ الَّذِي يُمِيتُ الْأَحْيَاءَ وَ يُحْيِي الْمَوْتَى وَ هُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْ‏ءٍ قَدِيرٌ .

en.hubeali: ‘I asked Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>, ‘What is the least of what would suffice me, from the Praise?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘You should be saying,

‘The Praise is for Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Who is Exalted, so Subdues, and the Praise is for Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Who is King, so is Able, and the Praise is for Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Who is within, so is Knowing, and the Praise is for Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Who Causes the living to die and Revives the dead, and He<sup>azwj</sup> is Able upon everything’.
en.sarwar: 7. Through the same chain of narrators it is narrated from abu ‘Abd Allah (a.s.) who has said the following: “The least for thanksgiving is to say, ‘All praise belongs to Allah who is High, so all things are subdued before Him, all praise belongs to Allah who owns all things, so He provides sustenance to all of them, all praise belongs to Allah who is inside, so He has the news of all things, all praise belongs to Allah who causes the living to die, gives life to the dead and has power over all things.’”
